name: mint production | mint | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15837/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg mint. The average yield from 2007 - 2008 is 63 t/ha. The data are representative for mint production in the United States of America (Idaho and Mississippi) used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 225-80-100 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 2 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing mint produced in the United States of America for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 1.8 (i.e. very good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with the nursery producing seedlings, i.e. seedlings from roots.

This activity ends with the clearing of the field (removing of mint plants). The dataset includes all activities of a year in the productive phase of the field including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (4 years), and the clearing of the field. 
The establishment phase of the field includes seedlings nursery, soil cultivation, planting, herbicide use and irrigation. 
The productive phase of the field includes machine operations, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation, fertiliser and pesticide application, harvesting, transport on farm and irrigation. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the field is cleared by removing the mint plants.
Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include drying.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0128:Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L3; Pesticides: L4; Machinery: L4; Irrigation: L3. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

The exchange has been updated from 'ammonium nitrate, as N' into 'ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0001 kg by 2.8573 kg of 'ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'ammonium nitrate, as N'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Brown et al. 2003) multiplied by the country-share of fertiliser type (IFA 2014). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 6.67 kg/ha

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'mint' is calculated to be circa 6.86E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.37E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
